revised_title: The Impact of Carbohydrate Metabolism and Muscular Exercise on Glucose Tolerance
tldr: This study investigates the effects of muscular exercise on carbohydrate metabolism and glucose tolerance. The authors found that after exercise, there is a reduction in glucose tolerance and a delay in the rise of the respiratory quotient. They also discovered that a high-carbohydrate diet has little effect on glucose tolerance, while a low-carbohydrate, high-fat diet significantly decreases it. These findings suggest that the activity of endocrine organs associated with carbohydrate metabolism may be correlated with the varying activity of muscles.
